title: ISic001120. Epitaph and relief for Kissos and Tryphon
body:
Facsimile Images

Κίσσος καὶ Τρύφων οἱ Εἰκαδίου
[ταλαίπωρ]οι καὶ ἄωροι χρηστο[ὶ]
χαίρετε

Apparatus criticus

Text of IGPalermo no.33

English translation

Kissos and Tryphon, sons of Eikadios, miserable and untimely (in death), good men, farewell!

commentary

Muscolino argues that the piece is probably an import in the ?early 16th century? from the Cyclades, since all the parallels for such a piece come from that region. The importation must have been early, since the piece was already recorded by Antonio Agustin in the mid 16th century in Palermo.

  • 3.5574 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001252
  • De Simone 1998 432 E1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002651
  • Manganaro 2000 264 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001812
  • Prestianni Giallombardo 1993 529 fig.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001659
  • Muscolino 2022 434-437 fig.1 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002809
